label: Aethiopia
description: Aethiopia is a term used in the Classical sources to refer both to Upper Egypt and the regions south of the Sahara desert. It is employed as early as the time of Homer.

label: Pieria
description: Originally the territory of the Pieres, later incoporated into Macedonia

label: Aegae
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 56 E4 Aegae

label: Ilium/Troia
description: An ancient city of northwest Anatolia with occupation ranging from the Bronze Age to the Roman period. Troy features as the central setting of Homer's Iliad.

label: Achaea/Achaia (region)
description: An ancient Greek region on the northern coast of the Peloponnese.

label: Argos
description: Argos was a city of ancient Greece that reached its cultural highpoint under Pheidon in the seventh century BC.

label: Lacedaemon/Laconia
description: Lacedaemon/Laconia is a region comprising the south-eastern part of the Peloponnese.

label: Pylos/Koryphasion
description: A Classical settlement, probably the Pylos of Thucydides, on the Koryphasion promontory, (modern Akr. Koryphasiou in Messenia) in the Peloponnese.

label: Ortygia
description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 61 E2 Ortygia
